comment._content: Rear Admiral Cameron McRae Winslow. A truncated bio of Winslow, from Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cameron_Winslow

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: He can be seen in other Bain pics here: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3120290855/] and here: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2929576774/] Some further useful biographical information here: auden.stanford.edu/cgi-bin/auden/individual.php?pid=I6787...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Admiral Winslow was described as "every inch a sailor," and "the handsomest flag officer in the Navy." He was a friend of former President Theodore Roosevelt, who had been Secretary of the Navy in his early career. In September, 1913, speculation in a New York Times story focused on Winslow as the likely future leader of the Atlantic Fleet, who would lead the fleet to the Pacific Ocean by way of the Panama Canal upon its completion in 1915. [But when the time came, Winslow was not the man chosen.] NYT story, September 28, 1913: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9B03E2D8163DE6...
